input.description: timeout-secs[Optional] Time in seconds after which the request will time-out of not completed. Default is: 60 secs

discovery-prop-key[Optional] This tag contains the name of the property of discovery entity by which we want to filter the search. Valid values - Enabled,Name,DisplayName,Description,Category,HasNonCategoryOverride,Priority,ManagementGroup,ManagementGroupId,HasNonCategoryOverride,Remotable, DataSource,Id,Status,LanguageCode,XmlTag

discovery-prop-val[Optional] This tag contains the value of the property specified in discovery-prop-key. Texts like true or false should be enclosed in single quotes if they are to be treated as String rather than as Boolean entities. NOTE: While retrieving discovery objects by key as 'Enabled', the value for 'Enabled' tag in 'discovery-prop-val' should be provided in single-quotes. Fo ex. 'true'

operand[Optional] This tag specifies the operation that will be applied between 'discovery-prop-key' and 'discovery-prop-val'.
Valid values - equals, not equals, matches

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <operation-name> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">get-discovery</xsl:text> </operation-name> <timeout-secs> <xsl:value-of select="'${timeout secs}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </timeout-secs> <command-parameters> <filters> <filter> <discovery-prop-key> <xsl:value-of select="'${tok1}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </discovery-prop-key> <discovery-prop-val> <xsl:value-of select="'${tok2}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </discovery-prop-val> <operand> <xsl:value-of select="'${tok3}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </operand> </filter> </filters> </command-parameters> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description: Utility to create items xml for the process - "Find Discovery"
